business.headline: Who files belated ITRs most often? Salaried employees, freelancers or gig workersWho ends up filing belated ITRs most often; salaried employees, freelancers or gig workers? While the Income-tax Department does not release category-wise data, expert observations reveal surprising trends behind delayed filings.

Inside the tax refund limbo: The bigger story behind the 'put on hold' alertsThousands of tax refunds were suddenly put on hold and the message gave no reasons, no timelines. What is really going on inside the income tax system, and why are even honest taxpayers being flagged?

More jobs, higher incomes: New Zealand PM Luxon hails India free trade agreementIndia and New Zealand have successfully concluded a comprehensive Free Trade Agreement, marking a significant milestone in bilateral relations.

Defence personnel get specialised home loan options. Details hereAs competition rises and metro demand cools, housing finance firms are recalibrating strategies, betting on defence families as low-risk, long-term borrowers who need customised loans rather than generic salaried products.

PAN–Aadhaar not linked after December 31? Be ready for penalty and ITR issuesThe December 31 PAN–Aadhaar linking deadline is crucial for taxpayers, as missing it may lead to penalties, ITR filing restrictions, refund delays and higher tax deductions at source.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as year-end rally fizzlesThe BSE Sensex closed at 85,041.45, down 367.25 points or 0.43%, while the NSE Nifty50 settled at 26,042.30, lower by 99.80 points. The session remained volatile, with markets slipping after early stability as investors turned cautious at higher levels.

Is India's housing market entering a new phase of lower sales but higher value?Even though the number of homes sold declined, the overall value of housing sales increased by 6% year-on-year. The total sales value crossed Rs 6 lakh crore in 2025, up from about Rs 5.68 lakh crore in the previous year, mentioned report.

Explained: Why copper prices have hit a record highThe rally is not the result of a single trigger. Instead, it reflects a powerful mix of rising demand, tight supply and supportive global conditions that have reshaped the copper market.

Why are Swiggy, Zomato and Amazon gig workers going on strike on December 31?The strike has been announced by the Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union along with the Indian Federation of App-Based Transport Workers.

Wonder drug for male baldness puts Swiss firm Cosmo's shares on steroidsStrong trial data has rewritten Cosmo's prospects, but the real test lies ahead as regulators, partners and patients decide whether this promising science can truly deliver commercial success globally eventually.

Sensex tumbles over 400 points: Why is the stock market down today?At 1:02 pm, the BSE Sensex was down 386.20 points to 85,022.50, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 106.80 points to trade at 26,035.30. Most of the broader market indices were also trading in negative territory as volatility rose during the session.

Hindustan Copper shares at 15-year high: What's driving the rallyThe stock has been one of the standout performers in the metal space, and Friday's move reflects a mix of strong commodity trends and sustained investor interest.

Made a mistake in your ITR? Here's how many times you can still revise itIf you think filing your income tax return locks everything in, that is not entirely true. The tax department recognises that genuine mistakes can happen and allows taxpayers to revise their returns, provided they act within the allowed time window.

How will insurance industry trends create new opportunities in 2026?Powered by artificial intelligence, rising climate risks, and changing customer expectations, the insurance industry is now silently transforming itself. Some of the trends that we may see in 2026 could look very different from what most people expect today.

Gold, silver extend record rally: Should you buy now?With gold anchoring portfolios and silver leading returns, should investors keep adding exposure, or step back and wait as record prices test discipline and long-term allocation strategies?

Is India's real estate market entering a more mature and institutional phase?Forces such as digitisation, institutional capital and changing consumer preferences reshaped the sector. More than just building structures, real estate is now about creating ecosystems that are interoperable with transit, logistics, digital infrastructure and services.

What happens if you do not file a revised ITR after your refund is put on holdWhen a return is flagged under the risk management framework, the refund does not move forward on its own. If a taxpayer does not revise the return or respond to the issue flagged, the refund can remain on hold indefinitely, even if the claim is otherwise genuine.

RVNL share price zooms over 11% today. What investors need to knowAt around 10:32 am, the RVNL share price was trading 11.01% higher at Rs 383.75 on the BSE, making it one of the top-performing public sector stocks during the session.

IRFC shares jump over 7% today. Here's what's driving the rallyAt around 10:32 am, IRFC shares were trading 7.42% higher on the BSE at Rs 130.50, emerging as one of the top gainers among public sector stocks during the session.

RVNL, IRFC, IRCTC: Why are these railway stocks rising today?At around 9:55 am, IRCTC was up 1.35% at Rs 688.85 on the BSE, while Rail Vikas Nigam Limited surged 8.94% to Rs 376.60. Indian Railway Finance Corporation also saw strong buying, rising 6.07% to Rs 128.87.

entertainment.headline: Exclusive: Vishal Jethwa talks Homebound, Oscar shortlist and finding his moment Actor Vishal Jethwa expresses joy as Homebound makes the Oscar shortlist. He reflects on his challenging role and the industry's evolving reception to outsiders.

Dhurandhar song Shararat: Krystle D'Souza addresses report she replaced Tamannaah Actor Krystle D'Souza has clarified that she was unaware of any plans to replace Tamannaah Bhatia in the song Shararat from Dhurandhar. Earlier, choreographer Vijay Ganguly, too, suggested the same.

Vijay mobbed by fans, trips and falls while exiting Chennai airport. Video Actor and politician Vijay stumbled at Chennai Airport on Sunday night after a large crowd gathered to greet him on his arrival from Malaysia. The actor was escorted by security to his car, amid the mob.

Kate Winslet reflects on teen years, says first intimate experiences were with women During a recent podcast, Kate Winslet opened up about her connection to her breakout role in Heavenly Creatures, discussing how her personal experiences shaped her understanding of the film's intense relationships.

Kiran Rao shares health update after appendix surgery, says she's recovering well Filmmaker Kiran Rao has shared an update following her recent appendix surgery, expressing gratitude to medical staff and friends after her hospital stay at Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital.

New Year buzz amid Dhurandhar fever: Ranveer–Deepika fan pics go viral Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone are currently on a holiday in New York. Fans who met the couple during their trip have shared photos and positive accounts of these chance meetings.

120 Bahadur on OTT: When and where to stream Farhan Akhtar's film, as per reports Actor-director Farhan Akhtar's 120 Bahadur, which recounts the story of the Battle of Rezang La, is reportedly set for a digital release. The film was released in theatres on November 21.

Big B, Shah Rukh to Salman: Bollywood praises Mumbai Police with fervour Amitabh Bachchan, Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan, and Akshay Kumar marked Mumbai Police's 10 years on social media. The actors recognised their efforts and applauded the creative campaigns inspired by Bollywood.

Stranger Things 5: Meet Indian-origin Linnea Berthelsen who plays Kali Prasad 008 Stranger Things Season 5 Volume 2 features the unexpected return of Kali Prasad, also known as 008. This has led to a significant rise in curiosity about the character and the actor behind her.

Watch: Thalapathy Vijay folds hands, blows kiss to fans before leaving Malaysia Actor Thalapathy Vijay left Malaysia for Chennai on Sunday following the audio launch of his upcoming film Jana Nayagan. The event attracted nearly 100,000 fans and set a new attendance record.

Akshaye Khanna 'doesn't care': Arshad Warsi says amid Drishyam 3 row As Akshaye Khanna faces allegations of unprofessional conduct, Bollywood actor Arshad Warsi has spoken about the Dhurandhar actor's personality. Arshad said Akshaye doesn't care about anything or anybody and lives life on his own terms.

Dhurandhar's Danish Pandor on reactions to violence in film: It's subjective As Dhurandhar continues its box office run worldwide, actor Danish Pandor reflects on the film's depiction of violence. He also recounted his first meeting with Ranveer Singh.

Shah Rukh Khan's stardom can be compared to Tom Cruise, Ronaldo: Terry Crews Terry Crews has praised Shah Rukh Khan's international stardom in a recent interview. He drew comparisons with Tom Cruise and Cristiano Ronaldo. The America's Got Talent host also expressed admiration for Bollywood's musical culture.

Tu Meri Main Tera box office Day 3: Kartik's film earns Rs 18.5 crore in India Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri, led by Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday, is witnessing a modest run at the box office. This is amid strong competition from Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar, which continues to break records both domestically and internationally.

When Section 375 writer accused Akshaye Khanna of dirty politics, claimed ouster As Akshaye Khanna faces scrutiny after reportedly walking out of Drishyam 3, an interview featuring Section 375 writer Manish Gupta has surfaced. In the interview, Gupta alleges Khanna orchestrated his removal as the film's director.

Brigitte Bardot, French icon and global cinema legend, dies at 91 Iconic French actor and singer Brigitte Bardot has died at the age of 91. The global cinema legend was known for her transformative impact on cinema and popular culture. Her legacy includes film stardom, a significant music career, and outspoken political activism.

Huma Qureshi is Elizabeth in Yash's Toxic. Check out first look Huma Qureshi's portrayal of Elizabeth in Yash and Geetu Mohandas's upcoming film Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-Ups has been revealed, highlighting the film's global ambitions and ensemble technical team ahead of its March 2026 release.

One last time: Atlee's remark wins hearts at  Vijay's Jana Nayagan music launch The audio launch of Jan Neta in Malaysia saw an emotional send-off for Thalapathy Vijay as filmmaker Atlee and fans celebrated the actor's reported final appearance on screen.

Your screen presence is enough: Prabhas praises Sanjay Dutt at Raja Saab event Rebel star Prabhas made a public appearance at The RajaSaab pre-release event in Hyderabad. His praise for Sanjay Dutt's screen presence has raised excitement for the film's release.

general news.headline: Peace deal close, but land disputes unresolved, says Trump after meeting ZelenskyyVolodymyr Zelenskyy, speaking alongside Trump, thanked the US president for the meeting and said the two sides had covered all aspects of a proposed peace framework. He said a 20-point peace plan is now 90 per cent agreed.

Dense fog blankets Delhi-NCR, low visibility delays flights, schools shut in NoidaThe India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert of very dense fog for Delhi, with maximum and minimum temperatures likely to hover around 22 and 7 degrees Celsius, respectively. Parts of Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand are also under the orange alert.

Video: Tamil Nadu boys attack migrant worker with sickles, flash 'victory' signA video showing four minors brutally attacking a migrant worker in Tamil Nadu with sickles has gone viral, triggering outrage and prompting a police investigation.

No proof: Indian forces junk Dhaka police claim on Osman Hadi killersA senior Dhaka Metropolitan Police officer had claimed that two prime suspects in the murder case had entered Meghalaya's Garo Hills region "with the help of local associates".

Vijay mobbed by fans, trips and falls while exiting Chennai airport. VideoActor and politician Vijay stumbled at Chennai Airport on Sunday night after a large crowd gathered to greet him on his arrival from Malaysia. The actor was escorted by security to his car, amid the mob.

No son should die this way: Tripura student's father, a BSF jawan, seeks justiceFather of Tripura student Anjel Chakma, who died after an alleged racist attack in Dehradun, demanded capital punishment for the accused.

At least 13 people killed, dozens injured after train derails in MexicoAuthorities said 193 people on board were confirmed to be out of danger following the derailment. At least 98 others were injured, with 36 receiving medical treatment at nearby hospitals and clinics.

India plan to rest Jasprit Bumrah, Hardik Pandya for New Zealand ODIs: ReportsIndia are set to rest Jasprit Bumrah and Hardik Pandya for the New Zealand ODI series. The move is aimed at preserving their fitness with the T20 World Cup fast approaching.

They went to Germany for degrees. Now Indian students face deportationHundreds of Indian students enrolled at a Berlin university are facing visa uncertainty and possible deportation instead of graduation. Confusion over hybrid course recognition and changing visa interpretations has left students stuck between authorities and universities, raising serious questions about Germany's international education system.

Dhurandhar song Shararat: Krystle D'Souza addresses report she replaced TamannaahActor Krystle D'Souza has clarified that she was unaware of any plans to replace Tamannaah Bhatia in the song Shararat from Dhurandhar. Earlier, choreographer Vijay Ganguly, too, suggested the same.

Bengaluru man flees after wife's suicide, travels 1,000 km, kills self in NagpurFearing police action, victim Suraj and his mother Jayanti fled to Nagpur after his newly-wed wife Ganavi allegedly died by suicide over dowry harassment. Jayanti survived the suicide attempt.

How Indian techies became new Communists for AmericansSuch was the fear and hate for Communists in the US, spouses used to spy on their partners. That same paranoia now seems to have been reserved for Indian techies. But how did Indians, who helped build Silicon Valley, become such subject of hate?

Video: Two helicopters collide midair over New Jersey, pilot killedThe Federal Aviation Administration said the collision involved an Enstrom F-28A helicopter and an Enstrom 280C helicopter. Only the pilots were on board each aircraft at the time of the crash.

World appreciates Trump: Putin envoy's big praise for US President amid peace talksKirill Dmitriev, Russian President Vladimir Putin's special envoy for investment and economic cooperation with foreign countries, said global sentiment favoured Trump's approach to the conflict after the US president held talks linked to the peace process.

Bajrang Dal storms UP cafe, assaults 2 Muslim youths attending Hindu friend's partyThe members of Bajrang Dal assaulted the two Muslim men over the allegations of "love jihad" at their Hindu nursing friend's party.

RSS is like al-Qaeda: Congress leader on Digvijaya's praise, BJP hits backManickam Tagore's comments drew strong condemnation from the BJP, the RSS and allied parties, who accused the Congress of indulging in vote-bank politics and insulting nationalist organisations.

Akshaye Khanna 'doesn't care': Arshad Warsi says amid Drishyam 3 rowAs Akshaye Khanna faces allegations of unprofessional conduct, Bollywood actor Arshad Warsi has spoken about the Dhurandhar actor's personality. Arshad said Akshaye doesn't care about anything or anybody and lives life on his own terms.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Ruthless India Women pile on misery for Sri Lanka in Trivandrum, take 4-0 leadIND vs SL, 4th WT20I: India took a 4-0 lead in the five-match series with a dominant 30-run win against Sri Lanka on Sunday at the Greenfield Stadium in Trivandrum. The visitors racked up their highest Women's T20I score, but it wasn't enough for them to chase down India's massive target.

US is 'real' United Nations, says Trump as Thailand-Cambodia fighting pausesTrump claimed credit for ending multiple conflicts during his second term and urged the UN to play a more active role in maintaining world peace.

India helped free Bangladesh. Why is it then a target of public rage?Bangladesh's anti-India sentiment, long an undercurrent shaped by history, geography and political rivalry, has intensified over the past decade as Sheikh Hasina's rule became increasingly identified with New Delhi's backing. Here's how it took shape, from the 1976 protests to the unrest of 2025.

Bangladesh calls attack on Hindus 'isolated incidents of criminal acts'The rebuttal followed India's statement describing violence against minorities in Bangladesh as unacceptable and calling for swift action against those responsible, amid rising diplomatic friction between the two countries.

Trump holds 'very productive' phone call with Putin before Zelenskyy meetThe phone call came just about an hour before Zelenskyy and Trump wer set to meet in Florida to push forward efforts to end the war in Ukraine.

Bengaluru man sexually assaults live-in partner; siphons Rs 20 lakh, goldA Bengaluru man has been arrested for allegedly cheating and sexually exploiting a woman after luring her into a live-in relationship for three years, during which he siphoned off around Rs 20 lakh and 200 grams of gold.

sports.headline: Cristiano Ronaldo sets 1000-goal target clear: I will reach that number for sure Cristiano Ronaldo has set his sights firmly on football's unreachable 1000-goal milestone. Fresh from Globe Soccer Awards recognition, the Al-Nassr star insists injuries aside, his scoring journey is far from finished.

India plan to rest Jasprit Bumrah, Hardik Pandya for New Zealand ODIs: Reports India are set to rest Jasprit Bumrah and Hardik Pandya for the New Zealand ODI series. The move is aimed at preserving their fitness with the T20 World Cup fast approaching.

Cristiano Ronaldo, Dembele, Yamal: All the winners at Globe Soccer awards Cristiano Ronaldo and Ousmane Dembele dominated the spotlight at the Globe Soccer Awards 2025. From PSG's sweeping success to Luis Enrique's coaching honour, the night celebrated football's biggest winners in Dubai.

World Rapid C'ships: Carlsen wins sixth title, Koneru Humpy settles for bronze Magnus Carlsen captured his sixth World Rapid Chess Championship title after a dramatic final day, while Koneru Humpy narrowly missed a record third women's crown, finishing third on tie-breaks despite sharing the top score.

SG Pipers kick off Women's Hockey India League with 2-0 win vs Ranchi Royals SG Pipers began their Women's Hero Hockey India League 2025–26 campaign with a convincing 2–0 win over Ranchi Royals, showing strong defensive organisation and clinical finishing. Navneet Kaur and Teresa Viana scored for the Pipers as the team controlled key phases of the match in Ranchi.

Revenge on mind, Aryna Sabalenka reflects on Battle of the Sexes loss to Nick Kyrgios World No.1 Aryna Sabalenka vowed to return stronger after a 3–6, 3–6 loss to Nick Kyrgios in Dubai's Battle of the Sexes exhibition, saying the clash gave her clear insight into his strengths and weaknesses ahead of a potential rematch.

Battle of Sexes: No winner found as Kyrgios trumps Sabalenka in straight sets Nick Kyrgios defeated Aryna Sabalenka in the Battle of the Sexes in Dubai. The event, which had flashes of brilliance, ended up being a complete dud.

Utter nonsense: Fans slam Sabalenka vs Kyrgios Battle of sexes match The faceoff between Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios drew the ire of the fans online, who questioned the purpose of the contest due to the difference in court dimensions. Kyrgios went on to beat the women's World No.1 in straight sets.

After record 80 vs Sri Lanka, Smriti Mandhana admits tough transition to T20Is IND vs SL: Smriti Mandhana overcame a mentally challenging shift from ODIs to T20Is to smash 80, praise Shafali Verma, and script history with 10,000 international runs as India went 4-0 up against Sri Lanka.

Ruthless India Women pile on misery for Sri Lanka in Trivandrum, take 4-0 lead IND vs SL, 4th WT20I: India took a 4-0 lead in the five-match series with a dominant 30-run win against Sri Lanka on Sunday at the Greenfield Stadium in Trivandrum. The visitors racked up their highest Women's T20I score, but it wasn't enough for them to chase down India's massive target.

Pakistan Cricket Board takes charge of Multan Sultans after ugly Ali Tareen exit The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has taken temporary control of Multan Sultans ahead of Pakistan Super League 2026 after a dispute with former owner Ali Khan Tareen.

Battle of the Sexes Highlights: Kyrgios beats Sabalenka in straight setsBattle of the Sexes Highlights, Aryna Sabalenka vs Nick Kyrgios: Aryna Sabalenka loses to Nick Kyrgios in straight sets in the Battle of the Sexes. Kyrgios beats Sabalenka 6-3, 6-3 and clinches the exhibition match in Dubai.

Shreyas Iyer set for ODI return, expected to play Vijay Hazare as well: ReportStar India batter Shreyas Iyer might make his return in the ODI series against New Zealand. Iyer has been out of action after copping a nasty spleen injury in India's 3-match series against Australia in October.

Former England cricketer and Cricket Board chief, Hugh Morris dies aged 62Hugh Morris, respected for his integrity and service to cricket as both a player and administrator, has passed away at 62 after a battle with cancer. Tributes from across the cricketing world recognise his impact on and off the field.

Mandhana joins Mithali Raj in elite list, gets to 10,000 international runsSmriti Mandhana joined an elite list of stars as she became the fourth batter in women's cricket to get to 10,000 international runs on Sunday, December 28.

If India don't want to shake hands, Pakistan have no desire either: Mohsin NaqviAt a press conference in Lahore on Sunday, PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi said Pakistan have no desire to shake hands with the Indian team if the gesture is not reciprocated. The two sides have not exchanged handshakes since the Men's Asia Cup in September earlier this year.

IND vs SL: Jemimah Rodrigues out of 4th T20I as India make 2 changesIndia will be without the services of Jemimah Rodrigues for the 4th Women's T20I against Sri Lanka as the batter misses out due to illness. India make two changes for the match with the series wrapped up.

Abhishek Sharma in hot form ahead of Vijay Hazare stint, smacks 45 sixes in the netsAbhishek Sharma smashed 45 sixes during a net session in Jaipur ahead of the Vijay Hazare Trophy, underlining his red-hot form as Punjab prepare for the domestic season.

4th WT20I Highlights: India overcome valiant Sri Lanka to make it 4-0India Women vs Sri Lanka Women, 4th T20I Highlights: India overcome the valiant effort from Sri Lanka to take their lead to 4-0 in the series as they win in Trivandrum by 30 runs. Chamari Athpaththu's 52 kept the visitors in the hunt but Vaishnavi changed the game around with her bowling.

Who is Jerrssis Wadia? India-born Australian batter lights up BBL with 24-run overIndia-born Jerrssis Wadia burst onto the BBL stage with a blistering 34 off 16, including a 24-run over against Brisbane Heat, announcing himself as a rising star for the Adelaide Strikers in the 2025–26 season.

Is Green's lack of self-belief reason behind poor form? Ex-Aus captain reactsFormer Australia captain Mark Taylor feels that a lack of self-belief is the reason behind Cameron Green's poor form in the ongoing Ashes 2025-26 series. Green has struggled with both bat and ball as his spot in the side has come under the scanner.

Ex-captain rues England's super-late 'Eureka moment' after Boxing Day Test winAshes: Former England captain Geoffrey Boycott is ruing the fact that England realised their lengths very late in the series. England finally won a Test match in the Ashes, while playing the Boxing Day game at the MCG.

Travis Head defends Jake Weatherald, sees promise despite Ashes setbacksAUS vs ENG: Travis Head urged patience with Jake Weatherald after a tough Ashes start, saying difficult conditions and early pressure should not define a player he believes is ready for international cricket.

PM Modi praises India for memorable 2025: Daughters of Bharat created historyPrime Minister Narendra Modi hailed 2025 as a landmark year for Indian sport, highlighted by historic cricket triumphs across men's, women's and blind teams and a breakthrough showing by para-athletes.

SCG Test ideal place for Usman Khawaja's Australia swansong: Brett LeeBrett Lee feels that the Sydney Test in front of his home crowd would be the ideal setting for Usman Khawaja's retirement from the game. Khawaja has struggled for form in 2025.n

Former Delhi Capitals batter smacks joint-fastest Women's T20 fiftyFormer Delhi Capitals batter Laura Harris smashed a joint-fastest 15-ball fifty, blasting 52 off 17 balls to power Otago to a six-wicket win over Canterbury in the Women's Super Smash 2025-26.

Aryna Sabalenka vs Nick Kyrgios, Battle of the Sexes: All you need to knowAryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios face off in a special 'Battle of the Sexes' exhibition. Here's when the match is being played, how to watch it live, and the rules that will be in place.

Pace legend Brett Lee honoured with Australian cricket Hall of Fame inductionLegendary fast bowler Brett Lee has been officially inducted into the Australian Cricket Hall of Fame. Lee represented Australia in 76 Tests, 221 ODIs and 25 T20Is, amassing a combined total of 718 wickets.

Abhishek Sharma checks in for Vijay Hazare Trophy 2025: WatchVijay Hazare Trophy 2025: Abhishek Sharma fine-tuned his bowling ahead of Punjab's Vijay Hazare Trophy match, while Shubman Gill's possible return after injury adds intrigue ahead of the Uttarakhand clash.

CSK's Jadeja 2.0? Akeal Hosein makes instant impact in SA20 opener, impresses AshwinAkeal Hosein impressed on SA20 debut with a quick 22 and figures of 1/19 for Joburg Super Kings, earning praise from Ravichandran Ashwin. Good signs for Chennai Super Kings' recent acquisition at the IPL auction?

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
